symptoms.name: High fever
symptoms.pattern: Lasts 3-5 days, abrupt onset, subsides rapidly on day 4

symptoms.name: Runny nose
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

symptoms.name: Irritability
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

symptoms.name: Tiredness
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

symptoms.name: Rash (exanthem)
symptoms.pattern: Macular or maculopapular, appears after fever subsides, prominent on chest and abdomen, less on face and extremities, lasts hours to 2 days, may be absent in 70% of cases

symptoms.name: Febrile seizures
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be alarming but usually brief and not dangerous
symptoms.pattern: Occurs in 5-15% of cases, triggered by high fever

risk_factors: Weakened immune system (increased risk of severe complications)

required: Characteristic history (high fever followed by rash)
